citation.article-title: Angulomicrobium tetraedrale, a new genus of budding bacteria with radial cell symmetry.

p.s: Description of Angulomicrobium gen. nov.
Angulomicrobium (angularis, from the Latin for angled, micros from the Greek for small, bios, from the Greek for life. Angulomicrobium is thus an angular microbe.)
The genus Angulomicrobium includes unicellular, Gram-negative, budding, polygonal bacteria.
It is monotypic.
The description of the genus is the same as for the species.
Type species Angulomicrobium tetraedrale sp. nov ("mushroom-shaped bacterium," Whittenbury am Nicoll, 1971; "tetrahedron," Namsaraev and Zavarzin, 1972).
Tetraedralis is from the Greek for tetrahedral.
The cells are Gram-negative, single or paired (1.1 x 1.5 μm; for strain 1109 - 0.95 x 1.2 μm).
They have radial symmetry, which is tetrahedral in the type strain, and flat in strain 1109.
The cells reproduce by budding, with the formation of a sessile bud at the apex of the tetrahedron (triangle).
Mother and daughter cells are identical in shape and size.
The intracytoplasmic membrane system is poorly developed.
The colonies are white, circular, and slimy, with a pearly luster.
Chemoorganotrophs.
Carbohydrates, amino acids, organic acids, and alcohols are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources (see Table 1).
Sugars are broken down by the Entner-Doudoroff pathway and the type strain also has the enzymes of the fructose-diphosphate pathway.
The type strain will grow on mineral medium with glucose as the sole carbon source.
Other strains require the addition of 0.02% yeast extract, which cannot be replaced by a mixture of vitamins of the B or by casamino acids.
Aerobic, catalase and oxidase positive.
Temperature range 15-35°C, optimal growth at 28-30°.
Optimal pH - 6.8-7.0.

Antibiotic sensitivity (μg/ml) of the type strain and strain 1109 as follows (respectively): penicillin G, 30 and 100; chloramphenicol-100 and 0.5; erythromycin - 10 and 30; actinomycin D - 5.0 and 8.0; polymyxin M - 50 and 10.
DNA composition of type strain: G+C 64.5 mol. % (68.2 mol. % according to other determinations.
Isolated from bog soils in the Moscow region.
Type strain Z-2821 (All-Union Culture Collection B-1335) also strain 1109 (All-union Culture Collection of Sciences B-1336).
The cultures are maintained in the Soil Microbiology Section of the Microbiology Institute, Academy of Sciences of the USSR.
